Create flows:

1. Each diagram starts with a start element. The start element is the blue circle.

2. To create code elements, click on the rectangle picture in the toolbar.

3. Click anywhere in the page to place the element.

4. Click on the arrow picture, to activate arrow placement.

5. To connect using the arrow, first click on start element then drag towards another element.

Set code:

1. Click an hold on the rectangular, diagram element

2. After a little bit, a popup will show up.

3. Click on "Set code" in the popup.

4. In the code library, select "Output Message Template" script. This type of script allows you to issue android notifications.

5. Enter the text you want printed, when the script is executed.

6. The diagram element will now display the code that will be executed.

Test your diagram:

1. Click on the three dots symbol in the top right corner.

2. Select the "Test" option.

3. First it will show you the JavaScript code. This is the code your diagram is transformed into.

4. If your script has any actions, like printing text, then these action will take place after clicking on "Test".

5. For example, notice how in the video an android text notification appears with the message "test". This message appears because we have a "print"\ code element in the script.

Script with conditionals:

1. The diamond element allows you to connect two different elements.

2. You can set an "if" script for the diamond element from the script library.

 3. To do this click and hold on the diamond element and select "Set Code".

4. After placing arrows, you can click and hold on the arrow to bring up an arrow menu.

5. In the arrow menu, you can select "YES" or "NO". The "YES" option will be executed if the diamond element condition is "true". Otherwise the "NO" arrow will be followed.

Saving scripts:

1. After you created and tested your diagram, click on the "SAVE" option.

2. You will be prompted to enter a name for the script.

3. After you saved your script, go to the "JOBS" tab to setup a script job.

4. Check out the tutorial in the jobs tab for more info.

Creating jobs:

1. Jobs allow you to schedule execution of your saved scripts.

2. Click on the plus icon to open the job creation screen.

3. Enter the name of your job.

4. Enter a description for your job.

5. From the "Scripts" dropdown, select the name of a script you created in the "SCRIPTING" tab.

6. If you want your job to be executed everyday at a certain time, use the "Execution time" option.

7. If you want your job to execute given a specific condition, use the "Event Trigger" option.
